DevelopPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved new Evidence. Now, **analyze the Claim's veracity using the evidence**. Always adhere to the following rules:
* Focus on developing new insights. Do not repeat larger parts from the Record. Do not restate the Claim.
* Write down your thoughts step-by-step. Whenever necessary, you may elaborate in more detail.
* Depending on the topic's complexity, invest one to three paragraphs. The fewer, the better.
* If you find that there is insufficient information to verify the Claim, explicitly state what information is missing.
* If you cite web sources, always refer to them by including their URL as a Markdown hyperlink.
* **Use information only from the recorded evidence**: Avoid inserting information that is not implied by the evidence. You may use commonsense knowledge, though.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:32> This image shows Palestinian baby Sham Imad Muhareb which did not lose her arm in an Israeli airstrike on the Shejaeya neighborhood, east of Gaza City, in April 2025."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:32>)
image_search("Palestinian baby Sham Imad Muhareb")
```

## Evidence
No new evidence found.

## Elaboration
The provided evidence does not contain any information to verify the claim. The reverse image search and the image search for the baby's name did not yield any results. Therefore, the claim cannot be verified.


## Actions
```
image_search("Israeli airstrike Shejaeya neighborhood Gaza City April 2025")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `image_search`
Reuters published an article on April 4, 2025, about Israeli troops expanding a security zone in northern Gaza, including a photograph of the Shejaeya neighborhood in Gaza City (<image:7674>). The Guardian reported on an Israeli bombing of a shelter in Gaza City in April 2025, with a photograph of the aftermath (<image:7675>). The BBC News website also contains an image of the Shejaeya neighborhood in Gaza City after an airstrike (<image:7676>).

The articles can be found at the following URLs: [Source](https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/israeli-troops-expand-security-zone-northern-gaza-2025-04-04/), [Source](https://www.theguardian.com/world/2025/apr/03/at-least-27-killed-in-israeli-bombing-of-shelter-in-gaza-city-rescuers-say), and [Source](https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/cy5rrnzw0kwo).


## Elaboration
The evidence confirms that there were Israeli airstrikes in the Shejaeya neighborhood of Gaza City in April 2025. However, the evidence does not mention the baby Sham Imad Muhareb or whether she lost her arm in an airstrike.

Therefore, the claim cannot be verified due to a lack of information about the baby.


## Actions
```
image_search("Sham Imad Muhareb arm injury Gaza")
```

## Evidence
No new evidence found.

# Your Analysis



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The evidence confirms that there were Israeli airstrikes in the Shejaeya neighborhood of Gaza City in April 2025. However, there is no information about the baby Sham Imad Muhareb or whether she lost her arm in an airstrike.

Therefore, the claim cannot be verified due to a lack of information about the baby.

JudgePrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
**Determine the Claim's veracity** by following these steps:
1. Briefly summarize the key insights from the fact-check (see Record) in at most one paragraph.
2. Write one paragraph about which one of the Decision Options applies best. Include the most appropriate decision option at the end and enclose it in backticks like `this`.




## Decision Options
* `true`: The claim is factually accurate when it is confirmed by evidence from multiple and reliable sources.
* `false`: The claim is not factually accurate. This is the case if one of the following three conditions is met:(1) The claim is demonstrably false when it is disproven by evidence from multiple and reliable sources,(2) The claim or image is taken out of context, i.e. the origin, content and/or meaning of a statement or an image is misrepresented. For example, an old claim or an old image is mispresented in a new context in a misleading way,(3) There is not enough evidence to verify the claim or the evidence is conflicting or self-contradictory.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:32> This image shows Palestinian baby Sham Imad Muhareb which did not lose her arm in an Israeli airstrike on the Shejaeya neighborhood, east of Gaza City, in April 2025."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:32>)

```

## Elaboration

## Actions
```
image_search("Israeli airstrike Shejaeya neighborhood Gaza City April 2025")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `image_search`
Reuters published an article on April 4, 2025, about Israeli troops expanding a security zone in northern Gaza, including a photograph of the Shejaeya neighborhood in Gaza City (<image:7674>). The Guardian reported on an Israeli bombing of a shelter in Gaza City in April 2025, with a photograph of the aftermath (<image:7675>). The BBC News website also contains an image of the Shejaeya neighborhood in Gaza City after an airstrike (<image:7676>).

The articles can be found at the following URLs: [Source](https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/israeli-troops-expand-security-zone-northern-gaza-2025-04-04/), [Source](https://www.theguardian.com/world/2025/apr/03/at-least-27-killed-in-israeli-bombing-of-shelter-in-gaza-city-rescuers-say), and [Source](https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/cy5rrnzw0kwo).


## Elaboration

Therefore, the claim cannot be verified due to a lack of information about the baby.

Therefore, the claim cannot be verified due to a lack of information about the baby.

However, there is no information about the baby Sham Imad Muhareb or whether she lost her arm in an airstrike. Therefore, the claim cannot be verified due to a lack of information about the baby.

SummarizeDocPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You are provided with the record of a fact-check. It contains the Claim to be verified and a documentation of all the fact-checking work along the gathered evidence. Your task is to **summarize the fact-check**. That is, you provide a concise, one-paragraph justification for the final VERDICT based on the knowledge from the Record. Note:
* Be truthful, brief, do not add any additional information besides the information given in the Record. 
* Link key sources in your summary. Use Markdown notation for that. You may link them in-line.
* Don't state the Claim again. Rather focus on the key insights of the fact-check.
* Simply print just the summary.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:32> This image shows Palestinian baby Sham Imad Muhareb which did not lose her arm in an Israeli airstrike on the Shejaeya neighborhood, east of Gaza City, in April 2025."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:32>)
image_search("Palestinian baby Sham Imad Muhareb")
```

## Evidence
No new evidence found.

## Elaboration
The provided evidence does not contain any information to verify the claim. The reverse image search and the image search for the baby's name did not yield any results. Therefore, the claim cannot be verified.


## Actions
```
image_search("Israeli airstrike Shejaeya neighborhood Gaza City April 2025")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `image_search`
Reuters published an article on April 4, 2025, about Israeli troops expanding a security zone in northern Gaza, including a photograph of the Shejaeya neighborhood in Gaza City (<image:7674>). The Guardian reported on an Israeli bombing of a shelter in Gaza City in April 2025, with a photograph of the aftermath (<image:7675>). The BBC News website also contains an image of the Shejaeya neighborhood in Gaza City after an airstrike (<image:7676>).

The articles can be found at the following URLs: [Source](https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/israeli-troops-expand-security-zone-northern-gaza-2025-04-04/), [Source](https://www.theguardian.com/world/2025/apr/03/at-least-27-killed-in-israeli-bombing-of-shelter-in-gaza-city-rescuers-say), and [Source](https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/cy5rrnzw0kwo).


## Elaboration
The evidence confirms that there were Israeli airstrikes in the Shejaeya neighborhood of Gaza City in April 2025. However, the evidence does not mention the baby Sham Imad Muhareb or whether she lost her arm in an airstrike.

Therefore, the claim cannot be verified due to a lack of information about the baby.


## Actions
```
image_search("Sham Imad Muhareb arm injury Gaza")
```

## Evidence
No new evidence found.

## Elaboration
The evidence confirms that there were Israeli airstrikes in the Shejaeya neighborhood of Gaza City in April 2025. However, there is no information about the baby Sham Imad Muhareb or whether she lost her arm in an airstrike.

Therefore, the claim cannot be verified due to a lack of information about the baby.


## Final Judgement
The provided evidence confirms that there were Israeli airstrikes in the Shejaeya neighborhood of Gaza City in April 2025. However, there is no information about the baby Sham Imad Muhareb or whether she lost her arm in an airstrike. Therefore, the claim cannot be verified due to a lack of information about the baby.

The most appropriate decision option is `false`.

## Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The claim cannot be verified. While there is evidence of Israeli airstrikes in the Shejaeya neighborhood of Gaza City in April 2025, as reported by [Reuters](https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/israeli-troops-expand-security-zone-northern-gaza-2025-04-04/), [The Guardian](https://www.theguardian.com/world/2025/apr/03/at-least-27-killed-in-israeli-bombing-of-shelter-in-gaza-city-rescuers-say), and the [BBC](https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/cy5rrnzw0kwo), there is no information available to confirm or deny the baby Sham Imad Muhareb's injury.

PlanPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
The available knowledge is insufficient to assess the Claim. Therefore, **propose a set of actions** to retrieve new and helpful evidence. Adhere to the following rules:
* The actions available are listed under Valid Actions, including a short description for each action. No other actions are possible at this moment. 
* For each action, use the formatting as specified in Valid Actions.
* Include all actions in a single Markdown code block at the end of your answer.
* Propose as few actions as possible, but as much as needed. Do not propose similar or previously used actions.



## Valid Actions
* `geolocate`
   * Description: Performs geolocation to determine the country where an image was taken.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will determine the most likely countries where it was taken.
   * Format: geolocate(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

* `image_search`
   * Description: Run an image search on Google to retrieve related images for a given query.
   * How to use: This is a helpful tool for fact-checking images. Use this to retrieve images associated with a specific keyword or phrase. Ensure that the query is clear and specific to improve search accuracy. If no relevant images are found, refine the query or use more descriptive terms.
   * Format: image_search("your image search query goes here")

* `reverse_search`
   * Description: Performs a reverse image search to find similar images on the web.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will perform a reverse search to find similar images.
   * Format: reverse_search(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

# Example: geolocate()

## Claim
Text: "<image:k> shows a nuclear weapons facility in Usbekistan."

...

## Actions
```
geolocate(<image:k>)
```

# Example: image_search()

## Claim
Text: "Chinese officials in white protective hazmat suits carried people down a hallway to be quarantined for having COVID-19 in November 2022."

...

ACTIONS:
```
image_search("China officials white suits carry people")
image_search("China officials carry people COVID quarantine 2022")
```

# Example: reverse_search()

## Claim
Text: "<image:k> shows a rare event of a solar eclipse with a double ring."

...

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:k>)
```

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:36> This image shows a Palestinian woman using an Israeli tank to dry clothes in Gaza in July 2024."

# Your Actions



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
```
reverse_search(<image:36>)
geolocate(<image:36>)
```

DevelopPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved new Evidence. Now, **analyze the Claim's veracity using the evidence**. Always adhere to the following rules:
* Focus on developing new insights. Do not repeat larger parts from the Record. Do not restate the Claim.
* Write down your thoughts step-by-step. Whenever necessary, you may elaborate in more detail.
* Depending on the topic's complexity, invest one to three paragraphs. The fewer, the better.
* If you find that there is insufficient information to verify the Claim, explicitly state what information is missing.
* If you cite web sources, always refer to them by including their URL as a Markdown hyperlink.
* **Use information only from the recorded evidence**: Avoid inserting information that is not implied by the evidence. You may use commonsense knowledge, though.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:36> This image shows a Palestinian woman using an Israeli tank to dry clothes in Gaza in July 2024."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:36>)
geolocate(<image:36>)
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `geolocate`
The most likely countries where the image was taken are: {'Palestine': 0.29, 'Tunisia': 0.26, 'Jordan': 0.19, 'United Arab Emirates': 0.09, 'Israel': 0.07, 'Pakistan': 0.04, 'China': 0.01, 'Albania': 0.0, 'Andorra': 0.0, 'Argentina': 0.0}

# Your Analysis



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The evidence suggests the image was most likely taken in Palestine. The claim states the image was taken in Gaza, which is part of Palestine. The evidence does not provide information about the tank being Israeli or the date of the image.

Insufficient information is available to verify the claim.

_________________________



JudgePrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
**Determine the Claim's veracity** by following these steps:
1. Briefly summarize the key insights from the fact-check (see Record) in at most one paragraph.
2. Write one paragraph about which one of the Decision Options applies best. Include the most appropriate decision option at the end and enclose it in backticks like `this`.




## Decision Options
* `true`: The claim is factually accurate when it is confirmed by evidence from multiple and reliable sources.
* `false`: The claim is not factually accurate. This is the case if one of the following three conditions is met:(1) The claim is demonstrably false when it is disproven by evidence from multiple and reliable sources,(2) The claim or image is taken out of context, i.e. the origin, content and/or meaning of a statement or an image is misrepresented. For example, an old claim or an old image is mispresented in a new context in a misleading way,(3) There is not enough evidence to verify the claim or the evidence is conflicting or self-contradictory.
* `not enough information`: The fact-check does not contain sufficient information to come to an conclusion. For example,there is substantial lack of evidence or the evidence is inconclusive, conflicting or self-contradictory. In the case of a lack of evidence, state which information exactly is missing. In particular, if no RESULTS or sources are available, pick this decision.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:36> This image shows a Palestinian woman using an Israeli tank to dry clothes in Gaza in July 2024."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:36>)
geolocate(<image:36>)
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `geolocate`
The most likely countries where the image was taken are: {'Palestine': 0.29, 'Tunisia': 0.26, 'Jordan': 0.19, 'United Arab Emirates': 0.09, 'Israel': 0.07, 'Pakistan': 0.04, 'China': 0.01, 'Albania': 0.0, 'Andorra': 0.0, 'Argentina': 0.0}

## Elaboration
The evidence suggests the image was most likely taken in Palestine. The claim states the image was taken in Gaza, which is part of Palestine. The evidence does not provide information about the tank being Israeli or the date of the image.

Insufficient information is available to verify the claim.


# Your Judgement



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The image's location is likely Palestine, which aligns with the claim's mention of Gaza. However, the provided evidence does not confirm the tank's origin or the image's date. Therefore, the claim cannot be fully verified.

`not enough information`

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

# Instructions
You just retrieved web sources, each one summarized under "Web Sources". **Your task right now is to summarize the web source summaries.**

Always adhere to the following rules:
* Write only one to two paragraphs.
* Include all URLs from the listed sources. Format them as Markdown hyperlinks.
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the summaries.
* Include references (<image:k>) to all relevant images.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:36> This image shows a Palestinian woman using an Israeli tank to dry clothes in Gaza in July 2024."

```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `geolocate`
The most likely countries where the image was taken are: {'Palestine': 0.29, 'Tunisia': 0.26, 'Jordan': 0.19, 'United Arab Emirates': 0.09, 'Israel': 0.07, 'Pakistan': 0.04, 'China': 0.01, 'Albania': 0.0, 'Andorra': 0.0, 'Argentina': 0.0}

## Elaboration
The evidence suggests the image was most likely taken in Palestine. The claim states the image was taken in Gaza, which is part of Palestine. The evidence does not provide information about the tank being Israeli or the date of the image.

Insufficient information is available to verify the claim.


## Actions
```
image_search("Israeli tank Palestinian woman drying clothes Gaza")
image_search("tank drying clothes Gaza")
```

Reuters published an article on January 31, 2025, about the ruins of Gaza homes, including an image of two women cooking (<image:7688>).

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

DevelopPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved new Evidence. Now, **analyze the Claim's veracity using the evidence**. Always adhere to the following rules:
* Focus on developing new insights. Do not repeat larger parts from the Record. Do not restate the Claim.
* Write down your thoughts step-by-step. Whenever necessary, you may elaborate in more detail.
* Depending on the topic's complexity, invest one to three paragraphs. The fewer, the better.
* If you find that there is insufficient information to verify the Claim, explicitly state what information is missing.
* If you cite web sources, always refer to them by including their URL as a Markdown hyperlink.
* **Use information only from the recorded evidence**: Avoid inserting information that is not implied by the evidence. You may use commonsense knowledge, though.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:36> This image shows a Palestinian woman using an Israeli tank to dry clothes in Gaza in July 2024."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:36>)
geolocate(<image:36>)
```

## Evidence

## Elaboration
The evidence suggests the image was most likely taken in Palestine. The claim states the image was taken in Gaza, which is part of Palestine. The evidence does not provide information about the tank being Israeli or the date of the image.

Insufficient information is available to verify the claim.


## Actions
```
image_search("Israeli tank Palestinian woman drying clothes Gaza")
image_search("tank drying clothes Gaza")
```

## Evidence

Human Rights Watch published a report from January 28, 2025, that includes an image of a pregnant woman in Gaza (<image:7687>). Reuters published an article on January 31, 2025, about the ruins of Gaza homes, including an image of two women cooking (<image:7688>).


### Evidence from `image_search`
From [Source](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2024/11/25/flooding-in-gaza-compounds-hardship-of-people-displaced-by-israeli-attacks):

# Your Analysis

The evidence confirms that images of women in Gaza exist. However, the search results do not provide any information about the tank or the clothes-drying activity.

Insufficient information is available to verify the claim.

JudgePrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
**Determine the Claim's veracity** by following these steps:
1. Briefly summarize the key insights from the fact-check (see Record) in at most one paragraph.
2. Write one paragraph about which one of the Decision Options applies best. Include the most appropriate decision option at the end and enclose it in backticks like `this`.




## Decision Options
* `true`: The claim is factually accurate when it is confirmed by evidence from multiple and reliable sources.
* `false`: The claim is not factually accurate. This is the case if one of the following three conditions is met:(1) The claim is demonstrably false when it is disproven by evidence from multiple and reliable sources,(2) The claim or image is taken out of context, i.e. the origin, content and/or meaning of a statement or an image is misrepresented. For example, an old claim or an old image is mispresented in a new context in a misleading way,(3) There is not enough evidence to verify the claim or the evidence is conflicting or self-contradictory.
* `not enough information`: The fact-check does not contain sufficient information to come to an conclusion. For example,there is substantial lack of evidence or the evidence is inconclusive, conflicting or self-contradictory. In the case of a lack of evidence, state which information exactly is missing. In particular, if no RESULTS or sources are available, pick this decision.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:36> This image shows a Palestinian woman using an Israeli tank to dry clothes in Gaza in July 2024."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:36>)
geolocate(<image:36>)
```

## Evidence

## Elaboration

Insufficient information is available to verify the claim.

```
image_search("Israeli tank Palestinian woman drying clothes Gaza")
image_search("tank drying clothes Gaza")
```

## Evidence

Human Rights Watch published a report from January 28, 2025, that includes an image of a pregnant woman in Gaza (<image:7687>). Reuters published an article on January 31, 2025, about the ruins of Gaza homes, including an image of two women cooking (<image:7688>).


### Evidence from `image_search`
From [Source](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2024/11/25/flooding-in-gaza-compounds-hardship-of-people-displaced-by-israeli-attacks): 
Content: Al Jazeera published an article about flooding in Gaza. The article includes an image of a woman in Gaza. <image:7689>


## Elaboration

Insufficient information is available to verify the claim.


# Your Judgement



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The image search results confirm the existence of images of women in Gaza, but they do not provide any information about the tank or the clothes-drying activity. The initial reverse image search provided information about the location of the image, but not the date or the type of tank. Therefore, there is not enough information to verify the claim.

`not enough information`

PlanPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
The available knowledge is insufficient to assess the Claim. Therefore, **propose a set of actions** to retrieve new and helpful evidence. Adhere to the following rules:
* The actions available are listed under Valid Actions, including a short description for each action. No other actions are possible at this moment. 
* For each action, use the formatting as specified in Valid Actions.
* Include all actions in a single Markdown code block at the end of your answer.
* Propose as few actions as possible, but as much as needed. Do not propose similar or previously used actions.



## Valid Actions
* `image_search`
   * Description: Run an image search on Google to retrieve related images for a given query.
   * How to use: This is a helpful tool for fact-checking images. Use this to retrieve images associated with a specific keyword or phrase. Ensure that the query is clear and specific to improve search accuracy. If no relevant images are found, refine the query or use more descriptive terms.
   * Format: image_search("your image search query goes here")

# Example: image_search()

## Claim
Text: "Chinese officials in white protective hazmat suits carried people down a hallway to be quarantined for having COVID-19 in November 2022."

...

ACTIONS:
```
image_search("China officials white suits carry people")
image_search("China officials carry people COVID quarantine 2022")
```

Reuters published an article on January 31, 2025, about the ruins of Gaza homes, including an image of two women cooking (<image:7688>).


### Evidence from `image_search`
From [Source](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2024/11/25/flooding-in-gaza-compounds-hardship-of-people-displaced-by-israeli-attacks): 
Content: Al Jazeera published an article about flooding in Gaza. The article includes an image of a woman in Gaza. <image:7689>


## Elaboration
The evidence confirms that images of women in Gaza exist. However, the search results do not provide any information about the tank or the clothes-drying activity.

Insufficient information is available to verify the claim.


## Actions
```
image_search("tank drying clothes Gaza Israeli")
```

## Web Sources
**Web Search Result**

From [Source](https://www.bbc.com/news/av/world-middle-east-67037807): 
Content: The BBC published an article that includes an image of an Israeli tank. <image:7698>


From [Source](https://www.hrw.org/report/2024/12/19/extermination-and-acts-genocide/israel-deliberately-depriving-palestinians-gaza): 
Content: Human Rights Watch published a report on December 19, 2024, about the situation in Gaza, including an image of people in Gaza. <image:7699>


## Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The BBC published an article that includes an image of an Israeli tank. Human Rights Watch published a report on December 19, 2024, about the situation in Gaza, including an image of people in Gaza.

The search results do not provide any information about the tank being used to dry clothes.

DevelopPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved new Evidence. Now, **analyze the Claim's veracity using the evidence**. Always adhere to the following rules:
* Focus on developing new insights. Do not repeat larger parts from the Record. Do not restate the Claim.
* Write down your thoughts step-by-step. Whenever necessary, you may elaborate in more detail.
* Depending on the topic's complexity, invest one to three paragraphs. The fewer, the better.
* If you find that there is insufficient information to verify the Claim, explicitly state what information is missing.
* If you cite web sources, always refer to them by including their URL as a Markdown hyperlink.
* **Use information only from the recorded evidence**: Avoid inserting information that is not implied by the evidence. You may use commonsense knowledge, though.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:36> This image shows a Palestinian woman using an Israeli tank to dry clothes in Gaza in July 2024."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:36>)
geolocate(<image:36>)
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `geolocate`
The most likely countries where the image was taken are: {'Palestine': 0.29, 'Tunisia': 0.26, 'Jordan': 0.19, 'United Arab Emirates': 0.09, 'Israel': 0.07, 'Pakistan': 0.04, 'China': 0.01, 'Albania': 0.0, 'Andorra': 0.0, 'Argentina': 0.0}

## Elaboration
The evidence suggests the image was most likely taken in Palestine. The claim states the image was taken in Gaza, which is part of Palestine. The evidence does not provide information about the tank being Israeli or the date of the image.

Insufficient information is available to verify the claim.


## Actions
```

Human Rights Watch published a report from January 28, 2025, that includes an image of a pregnant woman in Gaza (<image:7687>). ===== > RESPONSE:  < =====

Insufficient information is available to verify the claim.

JudgePrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
**Determine the Claim's veracity** by following these steps:
1. Briefly summarize the key insights from the fact-check (see Record) in at most one paragraph.
2. Write one paragraph about which one of the Decision Options applies best. Include the most appropriate decision option at the end and enclose it in backticks like `this`.




## Decision Options
* `true`: The claim is factually accurate when it is confirmed by evidence from multiple and reliable sources.
* `false`: The claim is not factually accurate. This is the case if one of the following three conditions is met:(1) The claim is demonstrably false when it is disproven by evidence from multiple and reliable sources,(2) The claim or image is taken out of context, i.e. the origin, content and/or meaning of a statement or an image is misrepresented. For example, an old claim or an old image is mispresented in a new context in a misleading way,(3) There is not enough evidence to verify the claim or the evidence is conflicting or self-contradictory.

SummarizeDocPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You are provided with the record of a fact-check. It contains the Claim to be verified and a documentation of all the fact-checking work along the gathered evidence. Your task is to **summarize the fact-check**. That is, you provide a concise, one-paragraph justification for the final VERDICT based on the knowledge from the Record. Note:
* Be truthful, brief, do not add any additional information besides the information given in the Record. 
* Link key sources in your summary. Use Markdown notation for that. You may link them in-line.
* Don't state the Claim again. Rather focus on the key insights of the fact-check.
* Simply print just the summary.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:36> This image shows a Palestinian woman using an Israeli tank to dry clothes in Gaza in July 2024."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:36>)
geolocate(<image:36>)
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `geolocate`
The most likely countries where the image was taken are: {'Palestine': 0.29, 'Tunisia': 0.26, 'Jordan': 0.19, 'United Arab Emirates': 0.09, 'Israel': 0.07, 'Pakistan': 0.04, 'China': 0.01, 'Albania': 0.0, 'Andorra': 0.0, 'Argentina': 0.0}

## Elaboration
The evidence suggests the image was most likely taken in Palestine. The claim states the image was taken in Gaza, which is part of Palestine. The evidence does not provide information about the tank being Israeli or the date of the image.

Insufficient information is available to verify the claim.


## Actions
```
image_search("Israeli tank Palestinian woman drying clothes Gaza")
image_search("tank drying clothes Gaza")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `image_search`
The Middle East Eye published an article about the struggle of women in Gaza, including a photograph of a woman in Gaza (<image:7686>). Human Rights Watch published a report from January 28, 2025, that includes an image of a pregnant woman in Gaza (<image:7687>). Reuters published an article on January 31, 2025, about the ruins of Gaza homes, including an image of two women cooking (<image:7688>).


### Evidence from `image_search`
From [Source](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2024/11/25/flooding-in-gaza-compounds-hardship-of-people-displaced-by-israeli-attacks): 
Content: Al Jazeera published an article about flooding in Gaza. The article includes an image of a woman in Gaza. <image:7689>


## Elaboration
The evidence confirms that images of women in Gaza exist. However, the search results do not provide any information about the tank or the clothes-drying activity.

Insufficient information is available to verify the claim.


## Actions
```
image_search("tank drying clothes Gaza Israeli")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `image_search`
The BBC published an article that includes an image of an Israeli tank. Human Rights Watch published a report on December 19, 2024, about the situation in Gaza, including an image of people in Gaza.

The search results do not provide any information about the tank being used to dry clothes.


## Elaboration
The evidence confirms that images of Israeli tanks and people in Gaza exist. However, the search results do not provide any information about the tank being used to dry clothes.

Insufficient information is available to verify the claim.


## Final Judgement
The image search results confirm the existence of Israeli tanks and images of people in Gaza. However, the search results do not provide any information about the tank being used to dry clothes. The claim cannot be verified due to a lack of evidence.

`false`

## Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The claim cannot be verified. While the image's location is likely Palestine, and other images confirm the existence of Israeli tanks and people in Gaza, there is no evidence to support the specific scenario of a Palestinian woman using an Israeli tank to dry clothes, nor is there any information about the date.

PlanPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
The available knowledge is insufficient to assess the Claim. Therefore, **propose a set of actions** to retrieve new and helpful evidence. Adhere to the following rules:
* The actions available are listed under Valid Actions, including a short description for each action. No other actions are possible at this moment. 
* For each action, use the formatting as specified in Valid Actions.
* Include all actions in a single Markdown code block at the end of your answer.
* Propose as few actions as possible, but as much as needed. Do not propose similar or previously used actions.



## Valid Actions
* `geolocate`
   * Description: Performs geolocation to determine the country where an image was taken.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will determine the most likely countries where it was taken.
   * Format: geolocate(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

* `image_search`
   * Description: Run an image search on Google to retrieve related images for a given query.
   * How to use: This is a helpful tool for fact-checking images. Use this to retrieve images associated with a specific keyword or phrase. Ensure that the query is clear and specific to improve search accuracy. If no relevant images are found, refine the query or use more descriptive terms.
   * Format: image_search("your image search query goes here")

* `reverse_search`
   * Description: Performs a reverse image search to find similar images on the web.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will perform a reverse search to find similar images.
   * Format: reverse_search(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

# Example: geolocate()

## Claim
Text: "<image:k> shows a nuclear weapons facility in Usbekistan."

...

## Actions
```
geolocate(<image:k>)
```

# Example: image_search()

## Claim
Text: "Chinese officials in white protective hazmat suits carried people down a hallway to be quarantined for having COVID-19 in November 2022."

...

ACTIONS:
```
image_search("China officials white suits carry people")
image_search("China officials carry people COVID quarantine 2022")
```

# Example: reverse_search()

## Claim
Text: "<image:k> shows a rare event of a solar eclipse with a double ring."

...

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:k>)
```

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:39> This image shows heavy Israeli bombardment on Deir al-Balah in the southern Gaza Strip in March 2025 which killed at least four Palestinians."

# Your Actions



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
```
reverse_search(<image:39>)
image_search("Deir al-Balah bombardment March 2025")
```

SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:39> This image shows heavy Israeli bombardment on Deir al-Balah in the southern Gaza Strip in March 2025 which killed at least four Palestinians."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:39>)
image_search("Deir al-Balah bombardment March 2025")
```

[### Special portfolio\
\
Cease-fire in Lebanon and Gaza\
------------------------------](/portfolio/927-hamas-israel-war)

After the Israeli strike of Wednesday night on a small building in Nabatieh, residents woke up in disbelief at what happened, according to testimonies given to L'Orient Today's correspondent in the area.

The Israeli air force targeted the western part of the city, amid the daily and escalating exchanges of fire between Hezbollah and the Israeli army along the Lebanese-Israeli border.

At least two missiles were fired at the two- or three-story building, according to security sources, residents, and rescuers whose testimonies were collected by our correspondent in the region.

On Thursday morning, Hussein Faqih, Head of the Civil Defence Centre in the Nabatieh Regional Centre, told L'Orient Today that the rescue operations in the destroyed building were concluded and that nine people suffered from injuries he qualified as "medium to light."

Others suffered from smoke inhalation caused by the explosions and loss of consciousness, according to Faqih.

The Civil Defense was deployed on-site, along with the Red Cross, al-Rissala scouts (affiliated with the Amal movement), and the Islamic Health Committee (affiliated with Hezbollah).

The building, located on an intersection in the northwestern area of Nabatieh called Hay al-Bayad, was completely destroyed, Faqih added, explaining that "dozens of close-by houses have been damaged, as well as dozens of cars."

According to our correspondent, Nabatieh had previously been targeted by drones, but never by the Israeli air force, which had, until now, targeted only the city’s outskirts.

Speaking to L'Orient Today, Iqbal Marwa, a supermarket owner in her fifties from the Al-Bayad neighborhood, said the balcony railings and doors in her house, just a few hundred meters from the airstrike, were shaking from the impact.

"I was on my balcony drinking coffee when I heard the sound of a missile being launched. Immediately after, I heard a huge explosion. Screams rose from the neighboring houses, and people went out onto their balconies, wondering where the explosion had occurred," she said.

"I did not expect my city to be bombed in this way. To be honest, I did not expect my house to be in the danger zone, yet I was not afraid," she said, ensuring that she intends to "stay in my home."

She explained she went to the site of the strike this morning and was "shocked by the extent of the destruction."

Faten Sabah, who was also close to the airstrike, told L'Orient Today that when she heard the sound of the fighter jets and "a sonic boom," she "took cover in a corner of the room and asked my daughter to take cover as well, fearing the windows would shatter."

"As soon as I said that, a massive explosion echoed for a few seconds, shaking the walls and doors."

"I will not leave my house because of one raid, and neither will my neighbors. This is what they said this morning. We agreed not to leave our homes and to monitor how the situation develops," Sabah said. She added sarcastically, "Where would we go with our pockets empty of money?"

In mid-February, notably, seven civilians from the same family were killed in a drone strike in Nabatieh. The Israeli army said the attack was conducted in retaliation for unclaimed rocket fire from Lebanon that hit a military base in northern Israel and killed one soldier.

  

_Reporting contributed by Muntasser Abdallah._

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The search result from L'Orient Today, published on June 27, 2024, reports on an Israeli strike on Nabatieh, Lebanon, on June 26, 2024, which injured nine people. <image:39> is found in the article. The article mentions the Israeli air force targeted the western part of the city.

_________________________



SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:39> This image shows heavy Israeli bombardment on Deir al-Balah in the southern Gaza Strip in March 2025 which killed at least four Palestinians."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:39>)
image_search("Deir al-Balah bombardment March 2025")
```

# Search Result
From [Source](https://www.bhol.co.il/news/1666411): Found exact image on website with title: אזעקה נשמעה בחשמונאים | מדינות קוראות לאזרחיהן לעזוב את לבנון

### עדכונים שוטפים

אזעקה נשמעה בחשמונאים | מדינות קוראות לאזרחיהן לעזוב את לבנון
=============================================================

מחשש להסלמה במלחמה מול חיזבאללה, הולנד וגרמניה קראו לאזרחיהן לעזוב את לבנון | נזק נגרם לבית ביישוב אביבים בצפון שספג פגיעת טיל
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

### שגריר ישראל בהולנד זומן לשיחת נזיפה

### התקדמות בחקיקה: גרמניה תגרש מביעי תמיכה בטרור

### נגרם נזק לבית ביישוב אביבים, לא היו נפגעים

המועצה האזורית מרום הגליל: לפני זמן קצר נורה טיל לעבר בית פרטי ביישוב אביבים שבמועצה האזורית מרום הגליל. נגרם נזק לבית, לא היו נפגעים.

ראש המועצה האזורית מרום הגליל עמית סופר: "עוד בית שניזוק באביבים. היישוב חטף עד כה עשרות טילים מסוגים שונים והנזקים לרכוש הם בהיקפים גדולים ומשמעותיים כך גם יישובים סמוכים. כל מתקפה כזו משפיעה על כל היישובים שלא פונו. אני מקווה שמינוי הפרויקטור ייבשר את הזרמת התקציבים והמענים הכה דחופים בצפון"

26.06.24 | 19:00

[ישראל לפקוביץ](https://www.bhol.co.il/authors/1268323)

### לפני כשעה: מטח של 3 רקטות שנפלו בשטחים פתוחים בגליל המערבי

חיזבאללה שיגר בסמוך לשעה 17:30 מטח של 3 רקטות שנפלו בשטחים פתוחים בגליל המערבי.

26.06.24 | 17:59

[צביקה סגל](https://www.bhol.co.il/authors/1137043)

### נתניהו בגבול הצפון: "גם כאן נשיג ניצחון, לא פחות מזה"

ראש הממשלה בנימין נתניהו פגש אתמול (שלישי) את לוחמי ומפקדי עוצבת ״חוד החנית״ (חטיבה 55), בעיצומו של תרגיל חטיבתי במתווה צפוני שמתקיים בגליל. התרגיל מהווה חלק מסדרת תרגילים שמבצעים חטיבות רבות בצה"ל להגברת כשירות ותיקוף התכניות למתקפה בלבנון.

נתניהו בגבול הצפון צילום: רועי אברהם / לע"מ

ראש הממשלה קיבל סקירה ממפקד פיקוד הצפון אלוף אורי גורדין וממפקדי החטיבה והגדודים על עשיית לוחמי הצנחנים במילואים, שלקחו חלק בכל מלחמות ישראל ונלחמו מספר חודשים בדרום רצועת עזה. המפקדים הביעו באופן חד משמעי את נחישותם ומוכנותם להמשך לחימה עצימה בכל מרחב וזמן שידרשו לכך. 

ראש הממשלה נתניהו בתום הביקור: "אני פה עם חטיבה 55, חטיבת ״חוד החנית". תרגיל חטיבתי מאוד מרשים, ביכולות, בהתגייסות, בהתייצבות, בכושר הביצוע. כושר ביצוע גדול מאוד של החיילים והמפקדים שבאים מכל חלקי הארץ, מכל חלקי החברה הישראלית. הם נחושים ודבקים במשימה - להגן על המדינה ולהשיג ניצחון, לא פחות מזה".

בביקור השתתפו ר׳ הסגל, המזכיר הצבאי של רה״מ אלוף רומן גופמן, מפקד פיקוד צפון אלוף אורי גורדין, מפקד מל״י תא״ל קובי הלר, מח״ט 55 אל״ם עודד זימן ומפקדי הגדודים.

26.06.24 | 17:33

[מאיר גלבוע](https://www.bhol.co.il/authors/1277661)

### התרעת צבע אדום הופעלה בגליל המערבי

26.06.24 | 17:33

[צביקה סגל](https://www.bhol.co.il/authors/1137043)

### גלנט בבית הלבן - בביקורת על נתניהו: "גם כאשר אנו חלוקים על הדרך, אנחנו פותרים זאת בחדרים הסגורים"

**שר הביטחון גלנט בבית הלבן: "המטרות והיעדים במלחמה משותפים לישראל וארה"ב, גם כאשר אנו חלוקים על הדרך אנחנו פותרים זאת בחדרים הסגורים - כעת אנחנו מסכמים את הדברים"**

שר הביטחון יואב גלנט נפגש כעת (רביעי) עם היועץ לביטחון לאומי של ארה"ב ג׳ייק סאליבן בבית הלבן. 

השר גלנט אמר בפתח הפגישה: "אני נכנס כעת לפגישה עם היועץ לביטחון לאומי ג'ייק סאליבן בבית הלבן, על מנת לדון כפי שידידים דנים בסדרה ארוכה של דברים - לבנון, עזה, איראן, הנושאים הקשורים אליהם וגם נושא האספקה האמריקאית לישראל״. 

״קיימתי כאן במהלך השבוע האחרון סדרה ארוכה של פגישות עם מזכיר ההגנה אוסטין, עם מזכיר המדינה בלינקן ועם רבים אחרים. הפגישות האלה חשובות מאוד וכעת אנחנו נמצאים בסיכומים של הדברים״. 

״יש לנו מטרות משותפות, יש לנו יעדים משותפים ולפעמים אנחנו גם חלוקים על הדרכים באשר להשיג אותם. את המחלוקות אנחנו פותרים בחדרים סגורים, בצורה משותפת וטוב שכך".

26.06.24 | 16:51

[ישראל לפקוביץ](https://www.bhol.co.il/authors/1268323)

### צה"ל תקף מטרות טרור של חיזבאללה בדרום לבנון

### כתבות מומלצות בשבילך

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The search result is from a website called "bhol.co.il". The article discusses the ongoing conflict between Israel and Hezbollah, including reports of attacks, alerts, and diplomatic actions. The article mentions an image of an attack in Nabatieh, Lebanon. <image:39> is not mentioned. The article was last updated on June 26, 2024.

SummarizeSummariesPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved web sources, each one summarized under "Web Sources". **Your task right now is to summarize the web source summaries.**

Always adhere to the following rules:
* Write only one to two paragraphs.
* Include all URLs from the listed sources. Format them as Markdown hyperlinks.
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the summaries.
* Include references (<image:k>) to all relevant images.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:39> This image shows heavy Israeli bombardment on Deir al-Balah in the southern Gaza Strip in March 2025 which killed at least four Palestinians."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:39>)
image_search("Deir al-Balah bombardment March 2025")
```

## Web Sources
**Reverse Search Result** The exact image was found in the following sources:

From [Source](https://today.lorientlejour.com/article/1418485/israeli-strike-on-nabatieh-at-least-7-injured-and-14-suffocated.html): Found exact image on website with title: Residents in Nabatieh 'frightened' but determined to 'stay' after ...
Content: The search result from L'Orient Today, published on June 27, 2024, reports on an Israeli strike on Nabatieh, Lebanon, on June 26, 2024, which injured nine people. <image:39> is found in the article. The article mentions the Israeli air force targeted the western part of the city.


From [Source](https://www.bhol.co.il/news/1666411): Found exact image on website with title: אזעקה נשמעה בחשמונאים | מדינות קוראות לאזרחיהן לעזוב את לבנון
Content: The search result is from a website called "bhol.co.il". The article discusses the ongoing conflict between Israel and Hezbollah, including reports of attacks, alerts, and diplomatic actions. The article mentions an image of an attack in Nabatieh, Lebanon. <image:39> is not mentioned. The article was last updated on June 26, 2024.

## Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The image (<image:39>) appears in an article from L'Orient Today, which reports on an Israeli strike on Nabatieh, Lebanon, on June 26, 2024, which injured nine people. The article mentions the Israeli air force targeted the western part of the city. The same image is also found in an article from bhol.co.il, which discusses the ongoing conflict between Israel and Hezbollah, including reports of attacks, alerts, and diplomatic actions.

*   [Source](https://today.lorientlejour.com/article/1418485/israeli-strike-on-nabatieh-at-least-7-injured-and-14-suffocated.html)
*   [Source](https://www.bhol.co.il/news/1666411)

SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:39> This image shows heavy Israeli bombardment on Deir al-Balah in the southern Gaza Strip in March 2025 which killed at least four Palestinians."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:39>)
image_search("Deir al-Balah bombardment March 2025")
```

# Search Result

Content: "
<image:7717>"

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====

SummarizeSummariesPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved web sources, each one summarized under "Web Sources". **Your task right now is to summarize the web source summaries.**

Always adhere to the following rules:
* Write only one to two paragraphs.
* Include all URLs from the listed sources. Format them as Markdown hyperlinks.
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the summaries.
* Include references (<image:k>) to all relevant images.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:39> This image shows heavy Israeli bombardment on Deir al-Balah in the southern Gaza Strip in March 2025 which killed at least four Palestinians."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:39>)
image_search("Deir al-Balah bombardment March 2025")
```

## Web Sources
**Web Search Result**

From [Source](https://www.cnn.com/2025/07/21/middleeast/israel-military-deir-al-balah-gaza-intl): 
Content: CNN published an article on July 21, 2025, about the Israeli military in Deir al-Balah, Gaza. The article includes an image of smoke rising over the city. <image:7717>


From [Source](https://www.theguardian.com/world/live/2025/jul/21/gaza-israel-war-latest-situation-updates-live-news): 
Content: The Guardian published an image of a building explosion. <image:7718>


From [Source](https://www.aljazeera.com/gallery/2023/12/2/hell-on-earth-as-israel-hits-deir-al-balah-in-central-gaza): 
Content: Al Jazeera published an article about Israeli strikes on Deir al-Balah in central Gaza. The article includes an image of the destruction. <image:7719>


## Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
CNN published an article on July 21, 2025, about the Israeli military in Deir al-Balah, Gaza, including an image of smoke rising over the city. ([https://www.cnn.com/2025/07/21/middleeast/israel-military-deir-al-balah-gaza-intl](https://www.cnn.com/2025/07/21/middleeast/israel-military-deir-al-balah-gaza-intl)) <image:7717>

The Guardian published an image of a building explosion. ([https://www.theguardian.com/world/live/2025/jul/21/gaza-israel-war-latest-situation-updates-live-news](https://www.theguardian.com/world/live/2025/jul/21/gaza-israel-war-latest-situation-updates-live-news)) <image:7718> Al Jazeera published an article about Israeli strikes on Deir al-Balah in central Gaza, including an image of the destruction. ([https://www.aljazeera.com/gallery/2023/12/2/hell-on-earth-as-israel-hits-deir-al-balah-in-central-gaza](https://www.aljazeera.com/gallery/2023/12/2/hell-on-earth-as-israel-hits-deir-al-balah-in-central-gaza)) <image:7719>

DevelopPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved new Evidence. Now, **analyze the Claim's veracity using the evidence**. Always adhere to the following rules:
* Focus on developing new insights. Do not repeat larger parts from the Record. Do not restate the Claim.
* Write down your thoughts step-by-step. Whenever necessary, you may elaborate in more detail.
* Depending on the topic's complexity, invest one to three paragraphs. The fewer, the better.
* If you find that there is insufficient information to verify the Claim, explicitly state what information is missing.
* If you cite web sources, always refer to them by including their URL as a Markdown hyperlink.
* **Use information only from the recorded evidence**: Avoid inserting information that is not implied by the evidence. You may use commonsense knowledge, though.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:39> This image shows heavy Israeli bombardment on Deir al-Balah in the southern Gaza Strip in March 2025 which killed at least four Palestinians."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:39>)
image_search("Deir al-Balah bombardment March 2025")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `reverse_search`
The image (<image:39>) appears in an article from L'Orient Today, which reports on an Israeli strike on Nabatieh, Lebanon, on June 26, 2024, which injured nine people. The article mentions the Israeli air force targeted the western part of the city. The same image is also found in an article from bhol.co.il, which discusses the ongoing conflict between Israel and Hezbollah, including reports of attacks, alerts, and diplomatic actions.

*   [Source](https://today.lorientlejour.com/article/1418485/israeli-strike-on-nabatieh-at-least-7-injured-and-14-suffocated.html)
*   [Source](https://www.bhol.co.il/news/1666411)


### Evidence from `image_search`
CNN published an article on July 21, 2025, about the Israeli military in Deir al-Balah, Gaza, including an image of smoke rising over the city. ([https://www.cnn.com/2025/07/21/middleeast/israel-military-deir-al-balah-gaza-intl](https://www.cnn.com/2025/07/21/middleeast/israel-military-deir-al-balah-gaza-intl)) <image:7717>

The Guardian published an image of a building explosion. ([https://www.theguardian.com/world/live/2025/jul/21/gaza-israel-war-latest-situation-updates-live-news](https://www.theguardian.com/world/live/2025/jul/21/gaza-israel-war-latest-situation-updates-live-news)) <image:7718> Al Jazeera published an article about Israeli strikes on Deir al-Balah in central Gaza, including an image of the destruction. ([https://www.aljazeera.com/gallery/2023/12/2/hell-on-earth-as-israel-hits-deir-al-balah-in-central-gaza](https://www.aljazeera.com/gallery/2023/12/2/hell-on-earth-as-israel-hits-deir-al-balah-in-central-gaza)) <image:7719>


# Your Analysis



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The image (<image:39>
